org.apache.paimon.io

Interface FileWriter<T,R>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - record type.
    R - file result to collect.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    KeyValueDataFileWriter, RollingFileWriter, RowDataFileWriter, RowDataRollingFileWriter, SingleFileWriter, StatsCollectingSingleFileWriter

    public interface FileWriter<T,R>
extends Closeable
    File writer to accept one record or a branch of records and generate metadata after closing it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abort()
      Abort to clear orphan file(s) if encounter any error.
      long recordCount()
      The total written record count.
      R result() 
      default void write(CloseableIterator<T> records)
      Add records from CloseableIterator to this file writer.
      default void write(Iterable<T> records)
      Add records from Iterable to file writer.
      default void write(Iterator<T> records)
      Add records from Iterator to this file writer.
      void write(T record)
      Add only one record to this file writer.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(T record)
    throws IOException
        Add only one record to this file writer.

        NOTE: If any exception occurs during writing, the writer should clean up useless files for the user.

        Parameters:
        record - to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - if encounter any IO error.

      • write

        default void write(Iterator<T> records)
            throws Exception
        Add records from Iterator to this file writer.

        NOTE: If any exception occurs during writing, the writer should clean up useless files for the user.

        Parameters:
        records - to write
        Throws:
        IOException - if encounter any IO error.
        Exception

        default void write(Iterable<T> records)
            throws IOException
        Add records from Iterable to file writer.

        NOTE: If any exception occurs during writing, the writer should clean up useless files for the user.

        Parameters:
        records - to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - if encounter any IO error.

      • recordCount

        long recordCount()
        The total written record count.
        Returns:
        record count.

      • abort

        void abort()
        Abort to clear orphan file(s) if encounter any error.

        NOTE: This implementation must be reentrant.

      • result

        R result()
  throws IOException
        Returns:
        the result for this closed file writer.
        Throws:
        IOException
